name: D. Alyona and Strings
statement:
After returned from forest, Alyona started reading a book. She noticed
strings and , lengths of which are and respectively. As usual, reading
bored Alyona and she decided to pay her attention to strings and , which
she considered very similar.Alyona has her favourite positive integer
and because she is too small, does not exceed . The girl wants now to
choose disjoint non-empty substrings of string such that these strings
appear as disjoint substrings of string and in the same order as they do
in string . She is also interested in that their length is maximum
possible among all variants.Formally, Alyona wants to find a sequence of
non-empty strings satisfying following conditions: can be represented as
concatenation , where is a sequence of arbitrary strings (some of them
may be possibly empty); can be represented as concatenation , where is a
sequence of arbitrary strings (some of them may be possibly empty); sum
of the lengths of strings in sequence is maximum possible. Please help
Alyona solve this complicated problem and find at least the sum of the
lengths of the strings in a desired sequence.A of a string is a
subsequence of consecutive characters of the string.
